title: optical glitch in some webkit based browsers
body:
i can see an optical glitch generated by the oc core when using one of these browsers: rekonq, konqueror, midori, epiphany. they all use the webkit rendering engine and show the same issue. other webkit based browsers appear not to be affected: chromium and safari render the view fine, though they probably use other webkit versions. 

see attached screenshot: the top controls panel defines an outset shadow style. the upper part of it (why is that defined anyway?) is pretty huge and the affected browsers apparently do not position the panel such that this upper shadow is hidden underneath the header panel. switching off that shadow style definitions removes the glitch. looks like a bug in the positioning computation in that engine, however at other elements the shadows do not produce this problem. i failed to identify the difference. 

no third party apps were enabled, both browsers are up to date and installed on the current opensuse based gnu/linux system. 

since apart from that glitch oc appears to be perfectly usable within these browsers it might make sense to invest into fixing that glitch.
